Housekeeper.desc: This app was designed to allow housemates to keep track of everything necessary to maintain a household and ease the communication of everyday tasks. This was my capstone project for the front-end portion of Nashville Software School.
features: Allow users to share to-do lists

MinibarTender.desc: An application for use in single bartender, single barback mini-bar setups which provides a POS for the bartender and inventory tracking and sales calculations for the barback. This application was developed for and is in use by a bar on Nashville's Lower Broadway.
features: Point of Sale and change calculation
Use with or without POS function

Stuff Hoarder.desc: This application was developed as a member of a group of four collaborators in my bootcamp cohort. This project was an exercise in building applications with React in a team environment. It went through a full planning phase, used GitHub for project tracking and version control, and Netlify for web hosting.
features: Searching and filtering with dynamic results
lessons: Using advanced state management to achieve live data filtering from a database
Integrating React packages for front-end features
Cooperating as a team to produce consistent styling and formatting across the application

Hip-Hop Pizza and Waangs.desc: This application was developed as a member of a group of three collaborators. It is a mock restaurant website where users can place orders and check for upcoming live shows. Administrator users can manage orders and view revenue from past orders.
lessons: Vanilla JS data graphing using SVG
